snippet: The police department in Ferguson, Mo., identified the officer who shot Michael Brown as Darren Wilson, and said he had an admirable record.
abstract: Chief Thomas Jackson of Missouri's Ferguson Police Department, at a hastily called news conference, reveals that name of police officer who shot teenage Michael Brown is Darren Wilson; few details are revealed about Wilson, though his professional record suggests someone who has avoided trouble.

byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN, JOHN SCHWARTZ and SERGE F. KOVALESKI
byline.contributor: Julie Bosman and John Schwartz reported from Ferguson, and Serge F. Kovaleski from New York. Tanzina Vega contributed reporting from Ferguson. Sheelagh McNeill contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The police department in Ferguson, Mo., identified the officer who shot Michael Brown as Darren Wilson, and said he had an admirable record.

headline.main: A Youth, an Officer and 2 Paths to a Fatal Encounter
headline.print_headline: A Youth, an Officer and 2 Paths to a Fatal Encounter
